2.0.1
------
In all the excitement of releasing Bus++ 2.0 a few bugs managed to sneak into the app (including some embarrassing spelling errors by the "develoepr"). This update squashes these bugs and also includes some tweaks to the design of the widget and stop switcher based on feedback from users.


2.0
------
Bus++ is 2 years old! To celebrate, Bus++ has gotten a pretty big facelift and a couple of new features.

- Cleaned up design: A bunch of the distracting fluff has been removed and the important stuff has gotten brighter and bolder. Hopefully the app should be generally clearer and a little less odd.

- iOS 10 Widget: The today widget has been redesigned to be an iOS 10 friendly widget. You can still find the widget on your Today view but you also now see the arrivals for your nearest stop by force touching the Bus++ app icon.

- Stop Switcher: For users with many favourites swiping through pages and pages of stops to get to the one you need can be tiresome. To help with this you can now tap the dots at the bottom of the screen to bring up the Stop Switcher and quickly jump to any of your favourites.

Thanks to everyone for putting up with Bus++, especially those who wrote in through the app's feedback feature. Features like the Stop Switcher are a direct result of people writing in to let me know what they love/hate about the app

More under the hood improvements for Bus++.  With this release, service updates should be more reliable and scrolling should now be buttery smooth (or at least more buttery than before).

This is a small update that optimises Bus++ for iPhone X.  Congrats to those who've nabbed one already.
This is a small update that optimises Bus++ for iPhone X.  Congrats to those who've nabbed one already.

This update consists of a bunch of under the hood preperations to get Bus++ ready for the big timetable changes on July 15th. Fingers crossed everything should go smooothly when the time comes but if you do notice anything odd please let me know so Bus++ can get fixed as soon as possible.

In addition to this there are a few extra nuggets of niceness in this update as well. Most of these are a direct results of feedback sent in through the app so thanks to all of you who got in touch.

TRAINS: The app now supports trains! From the map screen you can now add train stations as well as bus stops.

STOP MANAGEMENT: The Stop Switcher (accessible by tapping the dots at the bottom of the screen) now lets you quickly reorganize and delete stops by dragging and dropping.

WIDGET: The widget has had a slight redesign which also means the bus times should no longer get cut off for users with small text sizes.

CRASHES: There's been a number of crashes relating to iOS 10 and the Apple Watch which have been cleaned up.

This update addresses some issues around outdated stop information. It also should fix quite a few crashes, particularly around the Apple Watch app. The app now has an option in the settings screen for hiding all service warnings. Finally, the app has one less typo than it did last update.

A big thank you to everyone who helped make this update by sending in their feedback / bugs.
